column5: The river is just starting to heat up as the water temps begin to rise. Good action last wk before the snow, wind and rain turned the water to mud. Most anglers have been jigging using 3/8 -3/4 oz jigs, chartruese always seems to work well with orange being another good one. With most winds coming out of the N and E this year fishing has been taking place on the Michigan side of the river. Look for things to get better for the next 3 wks as fish will be finished spawning and ready to chow down. This past wknd the Maters Walleye Circuit was in town and 56 of the 112 teams came to the scales with over 30lb bags for 5 walleyes. We finished 7th with 38.27lbs respectivley, the winners had 43.49lbs.
~~~Dang that not bad for weights, good luck in the next Tourney
Well done Bob .. Some big bags !!
Wow, 7-8.5 lbs. average. That's some good walleye.
Ummm, I think i'm moving to Windsor
well done bob !!! thats some very nice weight for sure...thanks for the update on the river...cheers
what was the weight of the "big fish" for the tourney?
Daaaaang. I'm hoping to get down there in may. But life seems to keep conspiring against me!
Well done Bob, I have not faired quite as well just yet, been too muddy for me so far.  I have only managed 1 OOS Musky in my 2 times out so far.  Need winter to go away.
That's a normal average for a Lawrence tourney weights... With three fish weigh ins the winner usually has 20-25 lbs
Way to go Bobby D!!  Did Greg and Mark do well??  See you out in another couple weeks when I am done the spring honey do's....LOL!!!  Congrats on the tourney!!!   Chrispy!
BOB . great work. you spend countless hours, days out there.
Congrats on a great finish Bob, some good numbers there !!
Thanks for the report.  Nice bag of fish.
Great job capt. Looking forward to our trip in a couple weeks!
